## Solution - Problem 6.11

<p align="center">
![](images/266.png){width="500"}
</p>

Problem Statement:

A hollow copper rod (E = 110 GPa, v = 0.33) is subjected to torque T as shown. If length L = 0.8 m, outer diameter d$_o$ = 80 mm, and inner diameter d$_i$ = 40 mm, determine torque T if the rod twists 2°.

---
::: callout-note
## Step 1
Recall the definition of the angle of twist:
$$\theta=\frac{T*L}{G*J}$$
Additionally, recall the definition of shear modulus:
$$G=\frac{E}{2*(1+\nu)}$$
Begin by converting the twist angle from degrees to radians:
$$2^0*\frac{\pi\,rad}{180^0}=0.0349\,rad$$
Next finding the shear modulus:
$$G=\frac{110\,GPa}{2*(1+0.333)}$$
$$G=41.26\,GPa$$
Finding the polar moment of inertia next:
$$J=\frac{\pi*(r_o^4-r_i^4)}{2}$$
$$J=\frac{\pi*((0.04\,m)^4-(0.02\,m)^4)}{2}$$
$$J=3.77*10^{-6}\,m^4$$
:::
